title: must-compile-successfully ignored by ui tests

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: A-testsuite
labels.description: Area: The testsuite used to check the correctness of rustc

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
From what I can tell, ui tests that don't have any `//~ ERROR` annotations and have no stderr file are implicitly assumed to require successful compilation. We ought to reject such tests, and instead require an explicit `// must-compile-succesfully` comment.

Here are some mentoring instructions. The file that controls the test suite is [`runtest.rs`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/ab79caa828cf955e658faa4386cf9e8e0a8c3e28/src/tools/compiletest/src/runtest.rs). UI tests in particular are controlled by `run_ui_test()`:

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/ab79caa828cf955e658faa4386cf9e8e0a8c3e28/src/tools/compiletest/src/runtest.rs#L2381-L2448

You can see that it begins with a call to `compile_test`, but it does not inspect the return value from that function. In contrast, `compile-fail` tests check and -- if compilation is successful -- they require that a `must_compile_successfully` comment is present:

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/ab79caa828cf955e658faa4386cf9e8e0a8c3e28/src/tools/compiletest/src/runtest.rs#L153-L163

We want to do something similar, but in the `run_ui_test` function. This will likely reveal existing tests that need a `// must-compile-successfully` comment.
